title: Pixel 3 XL - battery drain / lag / google not working / deleted bluetooth devices / slow charge
content:
For the last few months my battery has been draining around 10% an hour. I've checked on the apps and none are using very much power. Chrome was at the top of the list at 5%

Last week I woke up in the morning and the google assistant wasn't working along with any bluetooth devices. Turns out all of my devices had been cleared from the phone so I had the re-pair all of them. I cleared the chase and storage on google but that didn't fix the assistant problem. I resetup my voice and that did the trick. But once I connected my pixel buds Google crashed again. Now every time I connect my pixel buds I get a message saying "Google keeps stopping." I am unable to activate the assistant by saying, "OK Google," but squeezing the phone still works. I can't do anything with the assistant on my pixel buds.

My phone has become painfully slow. Switching between apps takes at lest 5 seconds and I barely have any installed.

Also, my quick charge isn't so quick anymore. it takes 2 hours to charge from 20% to 80%. And yes, I am using the charger that came with the phone.

I'm on Android 9. I haven't done the most recent update because I've read a lot of people are having issues with it. 

So, to sum it up, my phone dies way faster than it should, it's runs like a snail, and I can't use the voice activated assistant.
